meanings.definition: The SI unit of electromotive force, the difference of potential that would drive one ampere of current against one ohm resistance.
meanings.sent1: A small battery produces only a few volts of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The light bulb requires a specific amount of voltage to shine brightly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got a shock when it tried to steal a volt from the power line.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like a surge of volts, energizing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm crackled with the power of a million volts, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.definition: A unit of electromotive force or potential difference equal to the difference of electric potential between two points on a conducting wire carrying a constant current of one ampere when the power dissipated between the points is one watt.
meanings.sent1: The technician measured the voltage across the circuit to ensure proper functioning.
meanings.sent2: The power plant generates thousands of volts to supply electricity to the city.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver joked that his speed was due to the extra volt in his engine.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a high voltage wire waiting to spark.
meanings.sent5: Her excitement was like a surge of volts, lighting up her face with joy.
